bubble_sort.name: Bubble Sort
bubble_sort.description: Simple comparison-based sorting that repeatedly swaps adjacent elements if they're in wrong order
disadvantages: Poor performance compared to O(n log n) algorithms

counting_sort.name: Counting Sort
counting_sort.description: Non-comparative integer sorting that counts occurrences of each element
advantages: Linear time complexity for small integer ranges

quick_sort.name: Quick Sort
quick_sort.description: Divide-and-conquer algorithm using pivot element to partition array

merge_sort.name: Merge Sort
merge_sort.description: Stable, divide-and-conquer sorting using merging of sorted subarrays
disadvantages: Slower than quick sort in practice

radix_sort.name: Radix Sort
radix_sort.description: Digit-based non-comparative sorting using counting sort as subroutine

heap_sort.name: Heap Sort
heap_sort.description: Comparison-based sorting using binary heap data structure

linear_search.name: Linear Search
linear_search.description: Sequentially checks each element of the list until the target element is found or the list ends.
disadvantages: Average and worst-case time is linear

binary_search.name: Binary Search
binary_search.description: Efficiently finds the position of a target value within a sorted array by repeatedly dividing the search interval in half.
advantages: Very efficient for large, sorted datasets

interpolation_search.name: Interpolation Search
interpolation_search.description: An improved variant of binary search for uniformly distributed sorted data, estimates the position of the target using the values.
advantages: Faster than binary search for uniformly distributed data
disadvantages: Requires sorted and uniformly distributed data
Can degrade to linear time if distribution is non-uniform

breadth_first_search.name: Breadth-First Search
breadth_first_search.description: Explores graph in levels using queue, useful for shortest path in unweighted graphs
advantages: Finds shortest path in unweighted graphs
disadvantages: High memory usage for large graphs

depth_first_search.name: Depth-First Search
depth_first_search.description: Explores graph depth-wise using stack/recursion, useful for path finding and cycle detection
disadvantages: Can get stuck in infinite graphs

dijkstra.name: Dijkstra's Algorithm
dijkstra.description: Finds shortest paths from source to all nodes in weighted graphs with non-negative edges

prim.name: Prim's Algorithm
prim.description: Greedy algorithm for finding minimum spanning tree (MST) in weighted undirected graphs

kruskal.name: Kruskal's Algorithm
kruskal.description: Finds MST using union-find to add edges in order of increasing weight

topological_sort.name: Topological Sorting
topological_sort.description: Linear ordering of vertices in DAG where u comes before v for every directed edge (u,v)

kadane.name: Kadane's Algorithm
kadane.description: Finds maximum sum of contiguous subarray in 1D array
disadvantages: Requires at least one positive number

longest_common_subsequence.name: Longest Common Subsequence
longest_common_subsequence.description: Finds length of longest common subsequence between two strings
advantages: Foundation for many string comparison problems

coin_change.name: Coin Change Problem
coin_change.description: Counts number of ways to make change for amount using given coin denominations

interval_scheduling.name: Interval Scheduling
interval_scheduling.description: Selects maximum number of non-overlapping intervals using greedy selection of earliest finishing times
disadvantages: Only works for interval selection problems

huffman_coding.name: Huffman Coding
huffman_coding.description: Constructs optimal prefix codes for data compression using frequency-sorted priority queue

boyer_moore_voting.name: Boyer-Moore Voting
boyer_moore_voting.description: Finds majority element (>n/2 occurrences) in linear time with constant space

strassen.name: Strassen's Algorithm
strassen.description: Optimized matrix multiplication using divide-and-conquer to reduce exponent below 3
advantages: Better asymptotic complexity than standard multiplication

closest_pair.name: Closest Pair Problem
closest_pair.description: Finds closest pair of points in 2D plane using geometric divide-and-conquer
closest_pair.cpp_implementation:
// Implementation requires point sorting and strip comparison
// Placeholder for recursive divide-and-conquer solution

kmp.name: Knuth-Morris-Pratt (KMP)
kmp.description: Pattern matching using prefix function to avoid redundant comparisons

rabin_karp.name: Rabin-Karp
rabin_karp.description: Hash-based substring search using rolling hash function

sieve.name: Sieve of Eratosthenes
sieve.description: Efficient algorithm for generating prime numbers up to n
disadvantages: Not suitable for single prime checks

euclidean.name: Euclidean Algorithm
euclidean.description: Efficient method for computing greatest common divisor (GCD)

mod_exponent.name: Modular Exponentiation
mod_exponent.description: Efficient computation of (base^exponent) mod modulus using binary exponentiation

linear_probing.name: Linear Probing
linear_probing.description: Open addressing collision resolution using sequential search in hash table
disadvantages: Degraded performance with high load factor

chaining.name: Chaining
chaining.description: Collision resolution using linked lists at each bucket

tree_traversals.name: Tree Traversals
tree_traversals.description: Depth-first traversal methods for binary trees

avl_tree.name: AVL Tree
avl_tree.description: Self-balancing BST with height difference constraint of 1 between subtrees

red_black_tree.name: Red-Black Tree
red_black_tree.description: Self-balancing BST with color properties and height balancing constraints

array_rotation.name: Array Rotation
array_rotation.description: Rotate array elements by k positions using reversal algorithm

two_pointer.name: Two-Pointer Technique
two_pointer.description: Efficient array traversal using pair of indices to reduce time complexity
disadvantages: Requires sorted array for some problems

waveform_sort.name: Waveform Sorting
waveform_sort.description: Arrange array in wave pattern (a[0] >= a[1] <= a[2] >= a[3]...)

cycle_detection.name: Cycle Detection (Floyd's Algorithm)
cycle_detection.description: Detects cycles in linked lists using slow/fast pointer approach
disadvantages: Only detects cycle presence, not entry point

reverse_linked_list.name: Linked List Reversal
reverse_linked_list.description: Reverses linked list using iterative or recursive pointer manipulation

heapify.name: Heapify
heapify.description: Converts array into valid max-heap/min-heap structure

extract_min_max.name: Extract Min/Max
extract_min_max.description: Removes and returns root element from heap while maintaining properties
